definition: to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate

sentences.english: Bt the same time, there has been a "regrettable" slowing of reforms inside Turkey.
sentences.chinese: 同時土耳其內部鼎新也“使人缺憾地”放緩了。

sentences.english: The adjustment of the interest rate will moderate.
This will lead to the downstream metallurgy and juki slowdown in demand.
sentences.chinese: 這將導致對下游冶金和重機需求放緩。

sentences.english: But the economy is slowing, and an election year looms.
sentences.chinese: 但經濟在放緩，而且選舉年將至。

sentences.english: That could mean the export recovery slows or stagnates.
sentences.chinese: 這可能意味着出口復甦放緩甚至停滯。

sentences.english: But the growth in China's ritziest areas shows no sign of slowing.
sentences.chinese: 但中國最富裕地區的增長並沒有放緩的跡象。

sentences.english: After spotted a shrinking decline in January, Feburary contract price seemed certain to rebound.
sentences.chinese: 一月下降幅度有所放緩，二月合同價看來註定反彈。

sentences.english: "Growth has slowed since the beginning of the year, " the beige book said.
sentences.chinese: “從今年的開始起增長就在放緩，”黃皮書上這樣說。

sentences.english: Now in his sixties, Miyazaki shows no sign of slowing down.
sentences.chinese: 現在60多歲，宮崎沒有顯示出放緩的跡象。

sentences.english: Inspite of the slowdown the Indian apparel sector has many advantages.
sentences.chinese: 儘管經濟增長放緩，印度的服裝界仍有許多優勢。

sentences.english: Two factors could help slow the beetle's eastward progress.
sentences.chinese: 兩個因素可以放緩山松甲蟲東進的步伐。

sentences.english: Facing the whole world financial crisis, our country economical speed-up postpones.
sentences.chinese: 面對全球金融危機，我國經濟增速放緩。

sentences.english: When an uzi deals 1 damage, it provides <1% slowdown to the tank.
sentences.chinese: 當一隻造成1點的傷害，它對坦克提供＜1%放緩。

sentences.english: Alas, sales slow again, and the government panics.
sentences.chinese: 唉，銷售又一次放緩了，這次政府恐慌了。

sentences.english: Intensification slowed down again and SONGDA did not gain strength significantly in the next two days.
sentences.chinese: 其後桑達增強速度再度放緩，兩天內只增強少許。

sentences.english: Some people in energy-rich states are preparing for a slowdown.
sentences.chinese: 在能源豐富的州，一些人正在爲放緩的到來做好準備。

definition: variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
